segments.text: So you're leaving tomorrow.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.  They just called.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: This is really-this is unfair.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't see [BREATHING]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't know what to say.  I don't want to go but I don't have a lot of choice.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I mean we both knew that this was going to happen.  It's just that I feel that, you know, I don't want Susie growing up without a mother.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And, uh, I'm afraid that if you, you know, when you leave, you won't come back.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm going to come back.  I need you to believe that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You don't know that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I need you to believe that too.  How am I supposed to believe everything's going to be okay if you don't?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll believe it, but- I'll believe it but it- I don't know that that's going to happen.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well you have to have faith because I don't have a choice and I have to go.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You do have a choice.  You don't have to go.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Do you think I want to leave you?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You have a choice.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I have to do this.  I don't want to leave.  Do you think I want to miss seeing her grow up?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I know.  It's just you don't have to do this for a living you know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're a smart person.  There are other things you can do.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Look we both knew what this meant when I signed on
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: And now- and now it's really shitty timing but now I have to go.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I mean I'm the one who has to leave here.  I'm the one who has to leave the two of you.  At least you get to be together.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's just not going to work out without you here.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What's that supposed to mean?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I mean we can't-we're not a complete family without you here.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well I'll come back.  What is that supposed to mean?  You're not willing to wait for me to come back?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Of course I'm going to wait.  I just- I just don't like the idea of this happening because this isn't the last time this is going to happen. You're going to go on more tours and stuff.  I just- I can't-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I can't deal with this emotionally.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What do you want me to do?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I want you to leave.  I want you to leave the service.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well I can't very well do it today.  I still have to leave tomorrow.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can do it today.  You don't have to do anything.  You don't have to do anything you don't want to do.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're not making this any easier for me, you know.  I'm the one who has to go and you're really not helping.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Look I'm just telling you that you don't have to go.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I do have to go. And I need to know that you're here waiting for me and that you believe that I'm coming back.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's all I'm saying... No you don't.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Thanks that helps.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's just really unfair.  This is- this is bullshit.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I feel much better now.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're acting like, you know, you're the one who's going all through, you know, all this shit and it's really- it's really not.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I know I'm leaving you here with all the responsibility but at least you get to be with her.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.  Of course I do because I didn't enlist in this stupid thing.  Why don't you just get out now and then-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I will but I can't right now.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes- You don't have to go.  What are they going to do?  Huh?  Put a gun to your head?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You know- you know how this works.  I have to go.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Then go.  We'll be here when you get back.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's how you want to leave it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't know how else to leave it.  What, do you want me to lie to you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You want me tell you that I'm okay with it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I want you to be okay with it as much as you can be.  I mean it's not a great situation but we don't have an option here.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well I can't be okay with it the same way you can't not go.  It just doesn't work that way.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Fine.
segments.speaker: F
